intro: Argostemmella, commonly known as the "false broomrape," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orobanchaceae. These plants are hemiparasitic, meaning they derive some nutrients from their host plants while also performing photosynthesis. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing on the roots of grasses or shrubs. Argostemmella species are characterized by their lack of leaves and their small, inconspicuous flowers. Their ecological role is primarily as a parasite, influencing the growth and distribution of their host plants.
